llm_res.rule: The function SHOULD throw if the message caller’s account balance does not have enough tokens to spend.
Transfers of 0 values MUST be treated as normal transfers and fire the Transfer event.
The function SHOULD throw unless the _from account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism.
MUST trigger when tokens are transferred, including zero value transfers.
MUST trigger on any successful call to approve(address _spender, uint256 _value).

llm_res:
YES

The function `totalSupply()` in the provided code violates the ERC-20 rule that requires it to return the total token supply. Instead of returning the constant total supply defined by `_tTotal`, the function modifies this value by adding 534 to it, which results in a different value being returned each time the function is called. This is not compliant with the standard behavior expected from the `totalSupply()` function according to the ERC-20 token standard, which should consistently return the total number of tokens in circulation (a constant value in this case).
